metadata.synopsis: After the player sleeps with Mizora, the person they are in a romance with catches them in the morning - or Wyll catches them as default.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Initiate a romance with an originHave Wyll in party and save Mizora in Act 2Sleep with Mizora in act 3

143.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground with the camera directly facing them. Mizora is not there, and there are no flames.

NOTE: Player sits in Jeff Goldblum languid pose.InternalNodeContext: If you reject Mizora in her ROM scene, this plays the morning after.

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *Morning - tainted by the faint whiff of sulphur. You may have rejected Mizora, but her essence still hangs in the air.*

233.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground with the camera directly facing them. Mizora stands behind the player, her wings open wide.
NOTE: Player sits in Jeff Goldblum languid pose.

JLatino: Cut flames "Both of them are burning in red flame."InternalNodeContext: If you "slept with" Mizora in her ROM scene, this plays the morning after.

250.speaker: Mizora
250.text: The pleasure of torment, the torment of pleasure.
250.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note: State mentioned below is incorrect. Player should stilll be seated, Mizora is standing

181.speaker: Mizora
181.text: Forever marked. It's not just a contract that binds us.

120.speaker: Mizora
120.text: Can't you feel it, pet? Where my lips scorched your skin? How your soul's frozen over?

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Your pores flood with heat and frigid water. Your parched tongue searches for the right response.*

240.speaker: Player
240.text: This was a mistake. Nothing more. I'm disgusted with myself.

107.speaker: Mizora
107.text: Tsk. You're a terrible liar. Your time in Avernus taught you nothing.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I should never have gone along with this. I regret every moment.

22.speaker: Mizora
22.text: Oh, but you made no complaint when our flesh met for the first time - or the tenth.

251.speaker: Mizora
251.text: One taste, one indulgence - but the delicious agony remains. A pity for you the one taste is all I'll give.
251.context:
CinematicNodeContext: NOTE: State below is wrong

[AMN][GUS-239513] Mizora steps towards the Player. She bends ove/crouches next to the player to deliver her line, meanwhile the player's love interest arrives.

Player stands stepping between the love interest and Mizora.

JLatino: Simplified above, no contact

116.speaker: Karlach
116.text: You've got to be kidding. Her?
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Karlach standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standing

40.speaker: Mizora
40.text: Me, darling. And you can have your turn, too, if you learn some manners.

94.speaker: Mizora
94.text: I think I'll nip out for a bit, let you lovebirds chirp. Who would I be to meddle in personal affairs?
94.context: NodeContext: Oh so cheeky and knowing.

27.context:
CinematicNodeContext: NOTE: Busted by Love Interest exit

[GERRY] From the shot's position at the end of N61. Mizora takes a step off to the side
jauntily waves at the Love Interest and exits
disappearing into magical circle.The flames surrounding the player and Mizora are extinguished from the previous nodes.

Player looks on as Mizora disappears.

NOTE: Mizora may be extra cocky and cheeky
as she's caused trouble and enjoys it very much

124.speaker: Karlach
124.text: You and Mizora. Wow. Just wow.

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: Was it everything you thought it'd be?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: It's not what you think, I swear.

242.speaker: Karlach
242.text: Do you really expect me to choke down that obvious bullshit?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Listen, Karlach. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: I'm sure that's true. But it doesn't change the way it makes me feel.
69.context: NodeContext: devastated cause the player has had an intimate experience with Mizora, who Karlach hates.

204.speaker: Karlach
204.text: I need... I need a minute.
204.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: devastated cause the player has had an intimate experience with Mizora, who Karlach hates.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: It was great, actually. I didn't know the Hells could be so heavenly.

134.speaker: Karlach
134.text: Listen to you. You have no idea what you're talking about.
134.context: NodeContext: devastated cause the player has had an intimate experience with Mizora, who Karlach hates.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

144.speaker: Karlach
144.text: You should've thought of that before you got close to that devil. Did you forget who she works for? Did you forget what Zariel did to me?

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Not bad. But it would have been even better If you'd been there too.

133.speaker: Karlach
133.text: I can barely look at that devil, much less touch her. How could you be so reckless?
133.context: NodeContext: devastated cause the player has had an intimate experience with Mizora, who Karlach hates.

243.speaker: Astarion
243.text: And? What do you have to say for yourself?

238.speaker: Player
238.text: What? Like you wouldn't have jumped at the chance.

209.speaker: Astarion
209.text: Well of course I would have! Sweet hells, it's not every day you can do a horizontal dance with a devil.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Listen, Astarion. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: Well of course it meant nothing! She's a devil, she's hardly going to fall in love.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: It was a mistake. You didn't invite me!
72.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'was'. Drop faux-serious tone on second line.

197.speaker: Astarion
197.text: Were you actually worried I was angry? Oh you sweet little thing - I'm not going to abandon a feast just because someone else had a nibble.
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: Well of course I'm jealous! It's not every day you can do a horizontal dance with a devil.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: So, what was it like? Tell me everything.
53.context: NodeContext: Looking for gossip about your partner's tryst

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Terrible. I regret ever agreeing to it.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: I'm honestly not sure. Good in the moment, but afterwards...

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: Afterwards you felt empty? Alone? Ashamed?

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: It happens, my dear. Best not to dwell on it. Not if you can move on to the next conquest.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: If you want 'healthy' advice, go talk to a druid. I'm just telling you what works.

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: Well... 'works' might be putting it a little strong, but... makes it feel less terrible, at least.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Does that work? Just ignoring it?

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: Well... no, not particularly. But it's better than facing up to it, at least.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: True. The next will be better!

262.speaker: Astarion
262.text: That's the spirit, just keep moving forward. And hope the past never catches up to you.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Not bad, but I wish you'd been there too.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: So do I, I've never tried my hand at seducing a devil.

161.speaker: Astarion
161.text: Just remember to fetch me next time. I'd hate to think you were holding out on me.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: It was great, actually. I didn't know the Hells could be so heavenly.

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: It does sound divine. You'll have to catch me up on all the gory details later.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: So... it seems you were having fun.
37.context: NodeContext: [STAYED SPAWN] Found his romantic partner sleeping with someone else - a little hurt, but trying to cover it

131.speaker: Player
131.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: I don't want to lose you either, but...

50.speaker: Player
50.text: What? Like you wouldn't have jumped at the chance.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: Once, maybe, but things change - people change. Even if they never imagined they could.

234.speaker: Astarion
234.text: I really thought there was more to you. That you were better than other people.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Don't be like that - it didn't mean anything.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Perhaps not, but now I'm wondering if any of this meant anything.

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: I thought I could trust you, which was no small thing. Now I'm not sure what to think.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Please, let's put this behind us. I promise it'll never happen again.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: I... I don't know if I should believe you, but I do.

68.speaker: Astarion
68.text: And if anyone should believe in forgiving and forgetting, I should.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: All right, we'll put this behind us. Just let's not do it again, hmm?

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: You can promise me the heavens, it doesn't change the choice you already made.

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: It was selfish. It was you not thinking about anyone but yourself. And that's a feeling I know all too well.

172.speaker: Astarion
172.text: I may not have the moral high ground when it comes to betraying trust, but right now, I see everything I've been trying to escape in you.
172.context: NodeContext: [STAYED SPAWN] Sadly reflecting on the situation

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: Even I deserve better than this. We're done.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You're one to talk, after how you've treated people.

117.speaker: Astarion
117.text: No, I'm not jealous. Disappointed, maybe.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: Don't lie to me! I know exactly what this was.
179.context: NodeContext: [STAYED SPAWN] Angry, but not explosively so - he's mostly just sad

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: Pleasant evening, I trust? I tidied up my hair and had an early night... but you don't look like you had much sleep at all.

263.speaker: Shadowheart
263.text: I'm not jealous, you know. If I wanted to bed something loyal and pure, I'd find a swan.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'm glad to hear you say it. I had no idea the Hells could be so heavenly.

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: Is that so? Clearly I've been going too easy on you...

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Listen, Shadowheart. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

237.speaker: Shadowheart
237.text: You were offered a chance, and you seized it with both hands - and some other parts besides. It's admirable, really.

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: The way I was raised, the way I was trained... well, it was positively encouraged, to get to know each other. Even from the memories I can recall, there's stories I could tell you...
38.context: NodeContext: Thinking back. Hint at a wealth of untold vignettes from her time with the Sharrans,.

183.speaker: Shadowheart
183.text: All that said, there's no harm in asking me in advance.

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: An adventurer's got to eat. What do I gain from denying your appetites?
219.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nonchalant shrug on first sentenceNodeContext: Nonchalant shrug on first sentence

217.speaker: Player
217.text: My apologies. I'll keep that in mind.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: Don't apologise. I'd rather see you happy than guilty.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: Just don't forget about me either - I have needs of my own.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: Playful

223.speaker: Player
223.text: I'm an adult. I don't need your permission.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: I'm not seeking to control you. All I ask is a little... consideration.

112.speaker: Shadowheart
112.text: That said, you can certainly do better then her. I should know.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: Cheeky

185.speaker: Player
185.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

261.speaker: Shadowheart
261.text: Spare me the scolded puppy routine - I already said I'm not angry. I'll still pet you as much as you like.

199.speaker: Lae'zel
199.text: Tell me. Did her skin taste as good as mine? Did her tongue make you shiver?
199.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: It's not what you think, I swear.

190.speaker: Lae'zel
190.text: Don't you dare subject me to petty lies.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: She was incredible in all honesty. I had no idea the Hells could be so heavenly.

160.speaker: Lae'zel
160.text: Kaincha. Haven't I suffered enough wounds for you to come slice me clean open?
160.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on. Kaincha = asshole. CANE-cha.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Listen, Lae'zel. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

211.speaker: Lae'zel
211.text: Is your mind so fragile that you couldn't say 'no'? Was our bond so weak that a single spark could break it?
211.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

100.speaker: Lae'zel
100.text: When the blade has cut clean through, it is too late for sorries.
100.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: I let my guard down. It won't happen again.
129.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: So that's it, then? No more 'us'?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Please, stay with me. No more dalliances - I only want you.

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: Is that what you said to her when she wrapped her wings around you?
137.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: It was only sex, Lae'zel. Do you have to be so dramatic?

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: I do not share. That is not drama - that is pride. You might want to find some of your own.
46.context: NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
9.context: NodeContext: ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO. Disappointed, upset, but holding back.

145.speaker: Lae'zel
145.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel turns and walks away after her line. The scene fades to black.NodeContext: Upset at player but holding it back. Girl's been cheated on.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: She wasn't bad. If you'd been there, you could have taught her a thing or two.

130.speaker: Lae'zel
130.text: Shka'keth! First, you cut me clean open. Then, you set my carcass aflame.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: I thought we shared something special, I truly did. Clearly I'm nothing but a smitten fool...

88.speaker: Player
88.text: It's not what you think, I swear.

198.speaker: Gale
198.text: I'm smarter than that, and so are you. It's part of what drew me to you.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I couldn't resist her. And it was incredible, to be honest.

71.speaker: Gale
71.text: Well, so long as you were able to indulge yourself, I suppose nothing - and nobody - else matters.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: Listen, Gale. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: You're smarter than that. It's part of what drew me to you.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

224.speaker: Gale
224.text: Some mistakes can't be resolved with an apology. Some mistakes, you have to carry with you, forever.
224.context: NodeContext: Sad, weary, Speaking from experience

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Come on. Don't tell me she didn't stir something in you, too.

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: No, of course she didn't. Why would I want anyone but you...?

180.speaker: Gale
180.text: I've... misjudged the situation. I gave my heart over to you too freely, and now it has been wounded. A mistake I shall not repeat.

244.speaker: Player
244.text: So that's it, then? No more 'us'?

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: As you say. Perhaps others could turn the other cheek, but I'm not that sort. It's for the best - to spare further heartache.

105.speaker: Gale
105.text: You still have me as an ally... but anything beyond that was just a fleeting dream - one from which I have now awoken.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: 'it's over between us'

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Please, stay with me. No more dalliances - I only want you.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: If only your mind had been so set last night. But alas, that bell cannot be unrung.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: It was only sex, Gale. Do you have to be so dramatic?

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: Diminish my feelings if you wish, but do not expect me to take this lying down - that's more your style, from what I can tell. My trust in you is broken.
86.context: NodeContext: caustic, wounded. 'take this lying down' intended as not-so-veiled intimate insult

260.speaker: Halsin
260.text: I can't help but sense a certain... ruefulness in you. Don't punish yourself on my account - remember we are both free to roam and love as we see fit.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: No, no regrets. It was great, actually. I didn't know the Hells could be so heavenly.

118.speaker: Halsin
118.text: Well, I'm glad you didn't feel the need to deprive yourself. To deny the most essential of impulses is to cut yourself off from nature.

236.speaker: Halsin
236.text: I just hope I don't seem boring to you now, in comparison. Perhaps I'll need to redouble my efforts, in future...
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: Humourously self-deprecating/flirty

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Listen, Halsin. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: Oh. Then I'm sorry to hear the encounter left a sour taste in your mouth. It can be... an unfortunate reality. I just hope it doesn't dissuade you from exploring nature's bounty.
70.context: NodeContext: Empathetic. The player's feeling some regret over a one-night stand with Mizora.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: It was a mistake, and I'm sorry. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: Worry not - I asked for freedom to follow my heart, and of course I offer it in return. There is so much to enjoy amidst nature's bounty - why squander what time we have on jealousy?

119.speaker: Halsin
119.text: If you ever want to talk, my ears are all yours. Any part of me is yours, should you wish.
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: Upbeat/comforting. Deliberate bit of lighthearted innuendo at the end.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: I was just thinking it was a shame you weren't there - you could have taught her a thing or two.

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: An intriguing prospect, for sure... but I'm glad you've shown yourself to be comfortable in exploring without me. Sharing is important, but some things should be just for you.

178.speaker: Halsin
178.text: But that said, don't allow me to talk myself out of a night to remember all the time...
178.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: Flirty

79.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
79.text: Explain yourself. Or is your tongue too-scorched from exploring that hellhole to form words?
79.context: NodeContext: sarcastic, but hiding genuine anger -about to break up with a cheating partner

16.speaker: Player
16.text: It's not what you think, I swear.

222.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
222.text: That is a relief, because I thought you had allowed a devil to enjoy your body. A body that belongs to me.
222.context: NodeContext: sarcastic on first note, quiet anger on last

150.speaker: Player
150.text: She was incredible. Who knew the Hells could be so heavenly?

230.speaker: Player
230.text: Listen, Minthara. She manipulated me into it. It meant nothing, I swear.

59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
59.text: Lies. If you were so easily manipulated, I would never have admired you as much as I did.

136.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
136.text: Leave. I have killed greater lovers for smaller betrayals than this.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara rises up to attack.NodeContext: quiet anger

14.speaker: Player
14.text: So that's it, then? No more 'us'?

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: There would be no more 'you' if I were not containing my anger.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Please, stick with me. No more dalliances - I only want you.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: I no longer care what you want. You had me - and now you have lost me.

252.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
252.text: I would enjoy punishing your body almost as much as I have enjoyed loving it, but I need you intact for the fights to come.

205.speaker: Mizora
205.text: Clean yourself off. Brimstone is an ill perfume.
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: disdain

125.speaker: Player
125.text: It was only sex, Minthara. Do you have to be so dramatic?

255.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
255.text: If I were being dramatic, I would take a knife to your most sensitive parts, and ensure you could never use them again.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: It was a mistake. If I could choose over again, I would.

153.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
153.text: Would it be a mistake if my dagger were to find your heart? I think not.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: You mean to tell me you're not even a little turned on by her?

162.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
162.text: More than a little. I would love to see her naked body bound to yours by barbed chains, as you both bleed out in a spider-pit.

182.speaker: Wyll
182.text: I was such a godsdamned fool. I believed in you. I believed in us.
182.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

30.speaker: Wyll
30.text: And out of every soul walking the planes, you chose her.
30.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

54.speaker: Player
54.text: It's not what you think it is, I swear.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: And I'd do it again. She was incredible.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: More incredible than the love we might have shared, the kingdom we might have built?
34.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

195.speaker: Wyll
195.text: We danced, we made a connection. And you severed it for a single bite of the Hells.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Listen, Wyll. She manipulated me into it. You of all people should understand.

163.speaker: Wyll
163.text: I gave up my soul for the city, not for some diabolical fling.
163.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

49.speaker: Player
49.text: It was a mistake. I don't want to lose what we have because of this.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: What did you expect? You layed a half-devil. She does not give without taking.
41.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

258.speaker: Wyll
258.text: I saw a future for us. A kingdom, even. And you shattered it for a single bite of the Hells.
258.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

208.speaker: Player
208.text: So that's it, then? No more 'us'?

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: You had your chance, and unleashed a wildfire. Nothing left but dust.
99.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

249.speaker: Player
249.text: Please, stick with me. No more dalliances - I only want you.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: It was only sex, Wyll. Do you have to be so dramatic?

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: You shared your body with the fiend who holds my soul. I can forgive it. I can't forget it.
17.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: You have my might - I owe you that much. But don't owe you more.
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades to black after the last line.NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

214.speaker: Wyll
214.text: You shared your body with the fiend who held my soul. I can forgive it. I can't forget it.
214.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Can you blame me? It's not like you've been putting out.

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: Is that what matters to you? Sex without union, heat without heart? Did you not take joy in the dance?
108.context: NodeContext: Upset - player cheating on him with his own cambion

193.speaker: Wyll
193.text: Countless souls walk these planes, countless ways to find pleasure. And out of all of them, you chose her.
193.context: NodeContext: Disappointed in player for sleeping with his devil patron

147.speaker: Wyll
147.text: Do you understand what she did - what you did?
147.context: NodeContext: Disappointed in player for sleeping with his devil patron, but not angry per se

132.speaker: Player
132.text: It's not what you think it is, I swear.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: Yes. I shared a night of ecstasy with the hottest devil this side of Avernus.

227.speaker: Wyll
227.text: Gods. You raced from the Hells only to plunge right back in, all for a damnable fling.
227.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but not angry. Player Wyll was not romancing slept with this devilish patron.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: Gods. You caused so much sorrow, all for a damnable fling.
82.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but not angry. Player Wyll was not romancing slept with this devilish patron.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: I had a bit of fun is all. Nothing to get worked up about.

159.speaker: Wyll
159.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but not angry. Player Wyll was not romancing slept with this devilish patron.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Nothing good, from the sounds of it.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but not angry. Player Wyll was not romancing slept with this devilish patron.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: No, but I bet you're going to tell me.

253.speaker: Wyll
253.text: For every pleasure you took, a damned soul suffered in the Hells. You fed on the hopeless, the frightened. Souls so desperate, they sold themselves to a devil.
253.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but not angry. Player Wyll was not romancing slept with this devilish patron.

216.speaker: Wyll
216.context: NodeContext: Wyll reveals why the player sleeping with Mimzora was so horrfying: she used the suffering of the damned to give you pleasure.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: So? They're already dead. What's a little more torture?

115.speaker: Wyll
115.text: Then you're no better than the wretches that condemned them.

221.speaker: Wyll
221.text: Raphael. Mizora. You know the ways of devils.
221.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but not angry. Player Wyll was not romancing slept with this devilish patron.

226.speaker: Wyll
226.text: And you know they don't give without taking.
226.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns and walks away after his line. The scene fades to black.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I should have known better. No patron gives without taking.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: You can't undo what you did. But you can exalt the souls who are still living.

257.speaker: Wyll
257.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns and walks away after his line. The scene fades to black.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Well. I hope I'm not interrupting.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Astarion standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standingNodeContext: Just walked in on your lover and a devil having a post-coital chat

176.speaker: Mizora
176.text: Astarion. What a pleasant surprise. I must have drawn more blood than I intended.

213.speaker: Shadowheart
213.text: Kind of you to offer a free sample then. Now that they've tried out inferior goods, they'll know just how good they has it already.
213.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Shadowheart standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standingNodeContext: Addressed to Mizora. A little barbed, but unthreatened - confident she has the player's affections.

148.speaker: Mizora
148.text: Well look who the Lady of Silver dragged in.

246.speaker: Mizora
246.text: Well look who snuck in from the shadows.

264.speaker: Lae'zel
264.text: Chk. I see your standards have markedly declined.
264.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Lae'zel standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standing

80.speaker: Mizora
80.text: On the contrary, my dear - unlike you, I know just where to bite.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: I had hoped my eyes were deceiving me... but no. You were with her, weren't you?
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Gale standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standingNodeContext: Quietly devastated

87.speaker: Mizora
87.text: Why, Gale - is that a hint of jealousy I detect?

39.speaker: Halsin
39.text: Well, it seems you have little fear of adventure of any sort, do you?
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Halsin standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standingNodeContext: A little wry. Not upset. (he's stumbled upon his non-exclusive romantic partner in the aftermath of a tryst with Mizora, a cambion (half-humanoid, half-succubs)

75.speaker: Mizora
75.text: Halsin, you saucy thing. Have those biceps of yours gotten even bigger?

215.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
215.text: The devil might just be the last
215.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Minthara standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standing

171.speaker: Mizora
171.text: Now now, Minthara. Can I help it if I'm too tempting to refuse?

111.speaker: Wyll
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves back and reveals Wyll standing there, looking on. NOTE: Player is already standing

93.speaker: Mizora
93.text: Last I checked, you were the only one of us tied to a leash.

78.speaker: Mizora
78.text: Last I checked, none of us was tied to a leash.

101.speaker: Mizora
101.text: I think I'll nip out for a bit, stretch my wings. And don't be too hard on them, pup. Don't you remember?

36.speaker: Mizora
36.text: I think I'll nip out for a bit, stretch my wings, trim my talons.

188.speaker: Mizora
188.text: But trust me, deary - the pleasure was all yours.

18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: NOTE: No Love interest

[GERRY+Latino] From the position of Mizora touching the player chin (her leaning over and player sitting - she stands up. Mizora turns roughly 90 degrees to the right and takes a few steps forward -  A diabolical circle appears under Mizora and she jauntily waves at the Player as she descends into it.

JLatino: Cut "The flames surrounding the player and Mizora are extinguished." and we leave the player on the ground.

113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pulls out to a neutral shot allowing the scene to end. NOTE: Player is alone, so alone.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: I feel it. But I'm not sure I like it.

218.speaker: Mizora
218.text: You may not like it. But you'll crave it in spite of yourself. A pity for you the one taste is all I'll give.
218.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note: Player should start out seated, then stand up once Mizora's done saying this lineNodeContext: Cut off when an unexpected visitor interrupts

192.speaker: Player
192.text: The flame always existed in me. But you were the one to kindle it.

166.speaker: Mizora
166.text: One spark, and the Hells were yours to devour. A pity for you the one taste is all I'll give.
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note: Player should start out seated, then stand up once Mizora's done saying this line

256.speaker: Mizora
256.text: Forever marked. We may not be pacted - but the Hells still bind us.

170.speaker: Mizora
170.text: And you - not a mark on you. You burn just as hot as myself, dear sister.

212.speaker: Mizora
212.text: You're forever marked. Can't you feel it - where my lips scorched your skin? How your soul burns with flame?
